oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Conway Twitty interview - Biff Collie - Happy Hour
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Conway Twitty (performer), conducted by Biff Collie, for his radio program Happy Hour.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie introduces Conway Twitty -- Conway Twitty talks about wanting to be a preacher when he was younger and considering going to seminary -- Twitty talks about wanting to be a professional baseball player before going into the army -- Twitty talks about starting out playing rock and roll -- Twitty talks about recording Its Only Make Believe, his first record -- Twitty talks about country music being so relatable to peoples lives -- Twitty talks about being a shy natured person, and how he developed his star persona -- Twitty talks about Harold Jenkins and where he was born -- Twitty talks about changing his name -- Twitty talks about his wife Mickey -- Twitty talks about meeting his wife -- Twitty talks about buying his wife a car -- Twitty talks about starting off in the rock genre and working his way up to country -- Twitty talks about wanting to stay in country music -- Twitty introduces the tune Hello Darlin' and concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Twitty, Conway;
